function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential spread of disease within the city's urban structure due to movement patterns and commuting","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission to various geographical locations within the city, including urban peripheries, airports, urban cores, and residential neighborhoods","Mitigation":"Implementing measures to lessen or eliminate the spread of viruses, such as designing interaction measures, considering health in urban planning, and modeling commuting patterns","Technologies":"Data modeling and urban planning software, digital mobility platforms, and public health tracking systems","People":"Urban residents, commuters, travelers, and vulnerable groups","Owner":"Urban planners, city officials, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Impact of social distancing measures on urban researchers and the public","Impact":"Changes in place attachment, personal space, and relationships between individuals and groups, as well as proximity to nature","Mitigation":"Revisiting concepts and theories related to place attachment, personal space, and relationships, and considering the impacts of social distancing on urban dynamics","Technologies":"Qualitative research methods, survey tools, and urban design software","People":"Urban researchers, public, and community members","Owner":"Urban researchers, community organizations, and urban planners"},{"Description":"Influence of personal experiences on place attachment","Impact":"Place attachment is multi-dimensional and cannot be explained through cause-and-effect relationships, depending on a reciprocal relationship between human behavior and past and current experiences","Mitigation":"Conducting in-depth qualitative research to understand the complex nature of place attachment and its relationship to personal experiences","Technologies":"Qualitative research methods, ethnographic studies, and personalized survey tools","People":"Individuals, community members, and researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, community organizations, and urban planners"}]}
